intro: Veronica rosea var. macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered speedwell, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It features upright stems that bear clusters of blue to violet flowers with prominent white markings. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. This variety is prized for its showy blooms and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
